channel.title: [317]duplicate case label[317]
channel.description:
Hi guys, I was adding a text Button so that when I click "yes" in the choice method, it would teleport me to 3414, 3488 but I get a "duplicate case label" error. I checked up what this means, and I have 2 "case 9157"'s But when I make it 9158, I get the same error and when I do 9159, it just doesnt work.
How would I find a solution to this? thanks.

item.title: [317]duplicate case label[317]
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

A duplicate case label is when you have the same case # twice in the same switch statement. So find and delete the old instance of case 9157 (assuming you’re using the right button IDs).

Edit:
Just realised what case 9157 does. Don’t delete it >_>
Just add another if statement within it (basing this off mine) which checks which dialogue you’re in and then make your teleport code in there.

For example (Delta):

if(c.NpcDialogue == x){ c.closeAll(); c.toX = ----; c.toY = ----; }

Read full topic
